clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Teleconsulting on Rehabilitation After Hip and Knee Surgical Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Teleconsulting on Rehabilitation After Hip and Knee Surgical Procedures

collaborator.agency: Agence Regionale de Sante d'Ile de France

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to assess the medical and economic relevance of teleconsulting for Rehabilitation After Hip and Knee Surgical Procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Functional subscore of simplified WOMAC Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 days after start of rehabilitation

secondary_outcome.measure: Joint Paint measured with visual analogue scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 days after start of rehabilitation
The last 1 day of the rehabilitation

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical and paramedical staff satisfaction questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after enrollment of the first patient
6 months after enrollment of the first patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of hospitalizations and use of emergency units
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 30 days after start of rehabilitation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Post hip or knee surgery
- Fulfilment of criteria for home rehabilitation (no need for hospital treatment post surgery)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Social isolation
- Life threatening condition
- No GSM network
- No DSL network
